title: How to Make Cheesecake Stuffed Strawberries

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients.
steps.description: Place all components (excepting the strawberries) in a bowl and stir it until everything is well mixed.

steps.headline: Pour your mixture into a gallon Ziploc bag and seal it up carefully, making sure that there are no holes or openings.
steps.description: Fold up the empty parts of the bag around the part that is filled.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the mixture.
steps.description: Place the Ziploc bag in the refrigerator and leave it there for forty-five minutes to an hour. Do not leave the mixture in the refrigerator for over an hour.

steps.headline: Prepare the strawberries.
steps.description: Carefully wash the strawberries and pat them dry. Cut the strawberries halfway through from the tip. Have two cuts, so the strawberries are now partially divided into quarters. Be sure not to cut the strawberries all the way through.

steps.headline: Place the strawberries in the fridge and wait until the cheesecake mixture is done refrigerating.
steps.description: Take out both strawberries and cheesecake.

steps.headline: Cut off one corner of the Ziploc bag.
steps.description: Spread open the strawberries from where you cut the "X" and fill them with the cheesecake mixture by squeezing the cheesecake out of the corner you just cut off.

text: Combine the ingredients. Place all components (excepting the strawberries) in a bowl and stir it until everything is well mixed. Pour your mixture into a gallon Ziploc bag and seal it up carefully, making sure that there are no holes or openings. Fold up the empty parts of the bag around the part that is filled. Refrigerate the mixture. Place the Ziploc bag in the refrigerator and leave it there for forty-five minutes to an hour. Do not leave the mixture in the refrigerator for over an hour. Prepare the strawberries. Carefully wash the strawberries and pat them dry. Cut the strawberries halfway through from the tip. Have two cuts, so the strawberries are now partially divided into quarters. Be sure not to cut the strawberries all the way through. Place the strawberries in the fridge and wait until the cheesecake mixture is done refrigerating. Take out both strawberries and cheesecake. Cut off one corner of the Ziploc bag. Spread open the strawberries from where you cut the "X" and fill them with the cheesecake mixture by squeezing the cheesecake out of the corner you just cut off. Finished.
